text.p: MBIA Inc announced Thursday it acquired MuniFinancial, the country's largest public finance consulting firm specializing in municipal debt administration.
Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.
MBIA is a financial guarantor and a provider of financial services to the public sector.

MuniFinancial, based in Temecula, Calif., provides a full range of services to municipalities, including administration of assessment and community-facilities districts, arbitrage rebate calculation, delinquency management and municipal disclosure.
The company has approximately 250 municipal clients and maintains client service offices in Chicago, Seattle, San Francisco, Sacramento, Washington, D.C., and Boca Raton.
David H. Elliott, chairman and chief executive officer of MBIA Inc., said, "The acquisition of MuniFinancial is a key element in further developing MBIA's municipal services capability."

"MuniFinancial's products and services support our goal of enhancing the efficiency of public finance as improved bond administration practices help strengthen the financial condition of municipal entities," he said.
MBIA Inc., through its wholly owned subsidiary, MBIA Insurance Corporation, is the leading insurer of municipal bonds and structured finance transactions.

MBIA Insurance Corporation has a claims-paying rating of triple-A from Moody's Investors Service Inc., Standard & Poor's Ratings Services and Fitch Investors Service. --U.S. Municipal Desk, 212-859-1650
